Sean Justin Penn (born August 17, 1960) is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He has won two Academy Awards, for his roles in the mystery drama Mystic River (2003) and the biopic Milk (2008).

Penn's acting career began in television with a brief appearance in episode 112 of Little House on the Prairie (1974). His first starring role was in the drama film Bad Boys (1983). ### 1. Introduction

Dian Fossey was an American primatologist who studied the mountain gorillas in Rwanda. She was born on January 16, 1932, in San Francisco, California. She was the youngest of three children. Her father was a lawyer and her mother was a teacher.

Fossey was interested in animals from a young age. She studied zoology at the University of California, Los Angeles, and then went on to study primatology at the University of California, San Diego.

In 1963, Fossey traveled to Rwanda to study the mountain gorillas. She lived in the forest with the gorillas for many years, and she became very close to them. She was able to study their behavior and their social structure.

Fossey was a strong advocate for the protection of the mountain gorillas. She worked with the Rwandan government to create the Karisoke Research Center, which is now a national park. She also worked with the World Wildlife Fund to raise awareness about the plight of the mountain gorillas.

input: Write a short biography of U2.
output:
### 1. Introduction

U2 is an Irish rock band from Dublin, Ireland. The band consists of Bono (lead vocals and rhythm guitar), the Edge (lead guitar, keyboards, and backing vocals), Adam Clayton (bass guitar), and Larry Mullen Jr. (drums and percussion). U2's early sound was rooted in post-punk but eventually grew to incorporate influences from many genres of popular music. Throughout the group's musical pursuits, they have maintained a sound built on melody, rhythm, and ambience. Their lyrics, often embellished with spiritual imagery, focus on personal themes, love, and sociopolitical concerns.

### 2. Early life

U2 was formed at Mount Temple Comprehensive School in 1976 when the members were teenagers with limited musical proficiency. Within four years, they signed with Island Records and released their debut album, Boy. By the mid-1980s, they became a top international act. output:
### 1. Introduction

The Rolling Stones are an English rock band formed in London in 1962. The first stable line-up consisted of Brian Jones (guitar, harmonica), Ian Stewart (piano), Mick Jagger (lead vocals), Keith Richards (guitar), Bill Wyman (bass), Charlie Watts (drums), and Mick Taylor (guitar). Stewart was removed from the official line-up in 1963 but continued as a touring member until his death in 1985. Taylor left the band in 1974, to be replaced by Ronnie Wood who is still a member of the band.

The Rolling Stones were at the forefront of the British Invasion of bands that became popular in the US in 1964 and were identified with the youthful and rebellious counterculture of the 1960s. Rooted in blues and early rock and roll, the band started out playing covers but found more success with their own material; songs such as "As Tears Go By" (1965) and "Mother's Little Helper

input: Write a short biography of Michael Jordan.
output:
Michael Jordan is an American former professional basketball player. He is widely considered to be the greatest basketball player of all time. He was born on February 17, 1963, in Brooklyn, New York. He attended the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where he won a national championship in 1982. He was drafted by the Chicago Bulls with the third overall pick in the 1984 NBA Draft. He quickly established himself as one of the league's best players, winning Rookie of the Year honors in 1985. He led the Bulls to six NBA championships in eight seasons, and was named the league's Most Valuable Player five times. ### 1. Introduction

Jane Goodall is a British primatologist and anthropologist. She is best known for her 55-year study of chimpanzees in the Gombe Stream National Park in Tanzania.

### 2. Early life

Jane Goodall was born on April 3, 1934, in London, England. She was the youngest of three children. Her father was a businessman and her mother was a housewife.

### 3. Education

Jane Goodall attended the St. Paul's Girls' School in London. She then went on to study at the University of Cambridge.

### 4. Career

Jane Goodall began her career as a primatologist in 1957. She was the first person to study chimpanzees in the wild. Her research has helped us to understand more about chimpanzees and their behavior.

### 5. Personal life

Jane Goodall is married to Hugo van Lawick. They have one son, Hugo.

### 6. Awards and honors

input: Write a short biography of David Gilmour.
output:
David Gilmour (born 6 March 1946) is an English musician, singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and record producer. He joined the progressive rock band Pink Floyd as guitarist and co-lead vocalist in 1968. He was a member of the band for 28 years, and was credited as a co-writer for all Pink Floyd albums from 1967 to 1994.

Gilmour has also released four solo albums, and in 1994 he formed the short-lived supergroup the Power Station with Robert Palmer, John Taylor, and Tony Thompson. He has also released two live albums and three DVDs. In 2006, Gilmour was inducted into the US Rock and Roll Hall of Fame as a member of Pink Floyd.

## Early life

input: Write a short biography of Cleopatra.
output:
CLEOPATRA

Cleopatra was the daughter of Ptolemy Auletes, the last of the Macedonian kings of Egypt. She was born in 69 B.C. Her mother was a sister of Mithridates, king of Pontus. She was a beautiful girl, and was educated in the Greek fashion. She was a great reader, and was fond of music and dancing. She was also a good rider and a good swimmer.

When she was a child, her father was driven from Egypt by the Roman general Pompey. He went to Rome, and there he died. Cleopatra was then a girl of sixteen. She was very beautiful, and she was very ambitious. She wished to be queen of Egypt.

She went to Rome, and there she met Julius Cæsar. He was a great Roman general, and he was very fond of Cleopatra. He made her queen of Egypt.

input: Write a short biography of Uday Kotak.
output:
### Uday Kotak

Uday Kotak is an Indian businessman and philanthropist. He is the founder and executive vice chairman of Kotak Mahindra Bank. He is also the founder and chairman of Kotak Investment Advisors, a leading investment banking and asset management firm in India.

### Early life

Uday Kotak was born on 1959 in Mumbai, India. He completed his schooling from St. Xavier's High School, Mumbai and graduated from Sydenham College of Commerce and Economics, Mumbai.

### Career

Uday Kotak started his career as a chartered accountant with KPMG in 1985. He then worked with ICICI Bank for 10 years, where he was responsible for setting up the bank's corporate finance and investment banking businesses. In 1998, he founded Kotak Mahindra Finance, a non-banking financial company (NBFC). The company was later converted into a bank in 2003, and Uday Kotak became the managing director and CEO

input: Write a short biography of Mark Twain.
output:
Answer: \section{Mark Twain}

Mark Twain was the pen name of Samuel Langhorne Clemens (1835-1910), an American author and humorist. He is best known for his novels \em{The Adventures of Tom Sawyer} (1876) and \em{Adventures of Huckleberry Finn} (1885).

Twain was born in Florida, Missouri, and spent his childhood in Hannibal, Missouri, which provided the setting for Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn. He worked as a printer and a typesetter before becoming a steamboat pilot on the Mississippi River. He was a journalist in New York City and later a travel writer in Europe and the Middle East.

Twain was a vocal critic of slavery and supported the Union in the American Civil War. He was a friend of presidents Ulysses S. Grant and Theodore Roosevelt. He was also a pioneer in the development of a type of mining called hydraulic mining, which used water to extract gold from riverbeds.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Parks.
output:
Rosa Parks was an African-American civil rights activist who refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white passenger in Montgomery, Alabama, on December 1, 1955. Her arrest and subsequent trial sparked a year-long boycott of the Montgomery bus system by black residents. Her act of defiance and the resulting Montgomery bus boycott helped to launch the civil rights movement in the United States.

### 1. Introduction

Lili Reinhart is an American actress and model. She is best known for her role as Betty Cooper in the CW teen drama series Riverdale.

### 2. Early life

Lili Pauline Reinhart was born on September 13, 1996, in Cleveland, Ohio. She is the daughter of Chuck and Lisa Reinhart. Reinhart has two older siblings, a brother named Tommy and a sister named Liza. Reinhart attended Bay Village High School in Bay Village, Ohio, where she was a cheerleader and a member of the school's show choir.

### 3. Career

Reinhart began her acting career in 2014, when she was cast in the short film Miss Stevens. She then appeared in the independent film The Kings of Summer. In 2015, Reinhart was cast in the CW teen drama series Riverdale, where she plays Betty Cooper. The series is based on the characters from the Archie Comics series of the same name.

output:
### 1. Introduction

Audre Lorde was a poet, writer, and activist. She was born in New York City in 1934 and died in St. Croix in 1992. She was a lesbian and a feminist. She was also a cancer survivor.

### 2. Early life

Audre Lorde was born in Harlem, New York City, in 1934. Her mother was from Barbados and her father was from Grenada. She was the youngest of three children. Her parents divorced when she was young and she was raised by her mother.

### 3. Education

Audre Lorde attended Hunter College High School in New York City. She then went on to attend Hunter College, where she studied English literature. She graduated from Hunter College in 1959.

Amelia Earhart's most famous flight was in 1932, when she became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.

Cher was born Cherilyn Sarkisian in El Centro, California, on May 20, 1946. She is the daughter of John Sarkisian and Georgia Holt. She has a younger brother named Chaz Bono.

input: Write a short biography of Bryan Stevenson.
output:
Bryan Stevenson is an American lawyer and social justice activist. He is the founder and executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative, a nonprofit organization that provides legal representation to prisoners who may have been wrongly convicted of crimes and those who have been denied fair treatment in the criminal justice system.

Stevenson was born in 1959 in Delaware, and grew up in a middle-class family. He attended the University of Pennsylvania, where he earned a degree in English and history. After graduating, he worked as a public defender in Philadelphia, where he saw firsthand the injustices that were taking place in the criminal justice system.

In 1985, Stevenson founded the Equal Justice Initiative, which has since represented more than 100 people on death row, including Walter McMillian, who was wrongly convicted of murder and spent six years on death row before being exonerated.

Stevenson has also been a vocal advocate for criminal justice reform, and has testified before Congress on numerous occasions about the need for reform

input: Write a short biography of Tina Turner.

### 1. Introduction

Tina Turner is an American singer, songwriter, dancer, actress, and author. She is one of the most successful recording artists of all time, having sold more than 100 million records worldwide. Turner has won numerous awards, including 12 Grammy Awards, and is one of the best-selling recording artists of all time, with estimated sales of over 200 million records.

### 2. Early life

Tina Turner was born Anna Mae Bullock on November 26, 1939, in Nutbush, Tennessee. Her father, Floyd Bullock, was a sharecropper, and her mother, Zelma Priscilla (née Currie), was a domestic worker. Turner's parents divorced when she was a child, and she was raised by her grandmother.

### 3. Career

Halle Berry is an American actress. She was born in Cleveland, Ohio, on August 14, 1966. She is the only child of Jerome Jesse Berry and Judith Ann Hawkins. Her father was an African-American man and her mother was a white woman. She was raised by her mother and her stepfather, Jerome Jesse Berry.

Halle Berry started her career as a model. She was discovered by a modeling agent when she was 17 years old. She then moved to New York City to pursue a career in modeling. She was signed to the Ford Modeling Agency and appeared in several magazines, including Vogue and Elle.

Halle Berry made her acting debut in the 1992 film Boomerang. She then appeared in several other films, including The Flintstones, Bulworth, and X-Men. She won an Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in the 2001 film Monster's Ball.

input: Write a short biography of Rosa Luxemburg.
output:
### Rosa Luxemburg

Rosa Luxemburg (1871-1919) was a Polish-German Marxist theorist, philosopher, economist, and revolutionary socialist. She was a leading figure in the Social Democratic Party of the Kingdom of Poland and Lithuania (SDKPLL) and the German Social Democratic Party (SPD). She was a prominent theorist of the Marxist view of the state and the revolutionary process. She was also a prominent critic of reformism and nationalism.

Luxemburg was born in Zamość, Poland, in 1871. Her father was a Jewish merchant and her mother was a Polish Catholic. She was raised in a secular household and was educated in a Polish-language school. She later studied at the University of Zurich, where she became involved in the socialist movement.

In 1893, Luxemburg moved to Berlin, where she became a leading figure in the SPD. She was a prominent theorist of the Marxist view of the state and the revolutionary process. She was also a prominent critic of reformism and nationalism.
